result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Kristine A. Jordan appeared by video, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  The public defenders office has yet to find an attorney for the Defendant.  Defendant wishes to exercise her right to court appointed counsel.   Court finds good cause to extend the time limits within which to conduct a preliminary examination.  Hearing is reset.    Court asks Defendant if she wishes to wait until she has counsel to have a bail modification hearing.  Defendant elects to wait until counsel is appointed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony child neglect-causing great bodily harm and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-24-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $25,000.00 cash with the condition that she have no contact with K.M.G., DOB: 12-21-21.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
